1511.content:
The woodsman started off by saying, "Ok here's what I saw, it was dark and foggy the night and I don't quite remeber a thing!" Jill by this time very frustrated said in an angry tone, "Look man are you going to tell us anything or not!?" "No I'm not after you spoke to me like that young lady." Jack tried to convice the woodsman that Jill was sorry but he said he wanted to hear Jill say it herself. So Jill mummble, "Sorry" the woodsman said, "You have to say it loud and clear and like you mean it." Jill refused to do that!
Then after a couple minutes Jack got her to say veyr politly, "I am sorry," for that Jack knew he owed Jill big time. Then th woodsman began again, "Well I'd like to remember what happened on that o so dark and foggy night but I think the only thing that will help jog my memory is a lady around my age." Jill burt like and air ballon! "WHAT!!! You mean I said sorry for noting!!?" Jill just completly lost her temper. Jack was getting very annoyed himself. He thought of what to do while Jill cooled down.
1511.title: Sorry For Nothing

choices: The wicked witch
The dworves
15112.content:
Deciding the woodsman's word wasn't very reliable, they decided to move on. "Now what?" Jill asked.

Jack turned to the prince. "Did anyone else ever come to visit Repunzal?"

The prince stopped to think a moment, then shook his head. "Not that i know of. She never let down her hair for anyone but me."

Jack nodded. "Well, it looks like we don't have anything else here to go off of. Sorry Prince, we'll have to move on and hopefully there be a clue to Repunzal's wear-abouts at the next crime scene."

Feeling hopeless, the prince nodded sadly and mounted his horse when something caught Jill's eyes. The horse was playing with something. She stepped closer to get a better look when she realized what it was. "An apple!" she cried.

Jill walked over and picked up the apple, examining it. "Someone's taken a bite out of it," she declared, holding it out so Jack, too, could get a good look at it.

"Jill, it looks like you've found us a clue. I only know one person this apple could belong to. The wicked witch!"

"I've seen one of the seven dworves with it too, though," the prince pointed out.

"Okay. So we'll pay the witch and the dworves a visit," Jack announced. "But who first?"
15112.title: First Clue

choices: Go Good Cop, Bad Cop on the Woodsman.
Ask him nicely what he saw.
1512.content:
"There is somthing else, I could use...to jog my memory", the Woodsman added.

"And what would that be?", Jack asked in an annoyed voice that mad Jill cringe.

One look at Jack's face and the Woodsman had decided that what he wanted wasn't that important. "Uh..nevermind that, I could use a good meal...", the Woodsman looked behind Jack where Jill was still standing.

"I'm not cooking for you!", screeched Jill as she pointed her finger at the Woodsman.

The Woodsman moved his gaze to Jack.

2hrs. later the Woodsman was filled with fresh stew that Jack had whipped up,"Just to please a witness," although Jill had seen joy on the face of the cooking Jack.

"Now. Down to bussiness."
1512.title: Somthing Else

choices: the path of least resistance
or the rocky road to turmoil
15121.content:
as soon as those words were spoken jack jumped up grabbing the wood mans axe jill cried "jack have you lost your mind no one touches a wood mans axe but he who owns it
"it is our only option jill" said a nervous jack. the woodsman watched with terrified eyes as his precious axe was sullied by one who was unworthy of it but it was to late for once the axe had been tainted it was no longer use able and he was to be banned from ever owning another. jill believing politness was the only key to the answer smiled sweetly at the woodsman and said"please give us your answer" "alas i have no choice " he replied" go to the land of never land, there you will be given a map by the lost boys, use it well" "Thank you jill replied meanwhile a stunned jack had dropped the axe knowing his actions had just cost the woodsman his livelihood he stammered an apology knowing it was worth nothing and stumbled out the door Just befor jill followed she gave the woodsman a quick hug without looking at his eyes. "well time to go to never land but wait is there anyway we can help the woodsman first" said jack jill said " there is fountain that will cleanse the axe but it is lost to all eyes" and besides that is another quest So they started out to neverland when they reached the cross path a lyrebird stood there and said you "cannot pass until you have answered my question "if you had to choose which would it be
15121.title: the woodsmans axe

choices: Go talk to the Chapter Ninja
Go in the direction the woodsman said the Ninja went
152.content:
"What do you want?" asked Jack.

"Listen, I've been expecting Little Red Riding hood to come around for a long time. She hasn't. If I tell you something about the person who carried of Rapunzel, then you'll find Red for me."

Jack and Jill heaved a sigh of relief. They were going to find Red anyway, so this was kind of free.

"Ok, it's a deal," answered Jack, "but tell us what we need to know."


"Rapunzel was looking at the window there-" the woodsman stopped to point, then continued, "and I was watchin' her from behind some trees. Suddenly, this guy in all black comes running up, and climbed up the wall like a spider! He then grabbed the girl by the hair, and lowered her out the window. Then he came down, and carred her off."

"And you didn't do anything?" asked Jack.

"It was quicker than lightening! For all I knew, he was the prince while he was riding up, and when he got Rapunzel down, he was off in a flash."

Jack scolwed. "What did his face look like?"

"He was dressed in all black, and he had a black mask covering his face. I think he was a ninja."

Jack and Jill gasped, then turned around to talk so the other two couldn't hear.

"Do you think it was the chapter ninja?" asked Jack.

"It couldn't be!" whispered Jill. "He's such a nice guy... that is, if you do things right when you're in that group!"

"Well," said Jack, "We should probably
152.title: News of Rapunzel's Capture

choices: Wenston has no idea what Jill is talking about
Wenston tells all!
1521.content:
"Well," said Jack, "We should probably go talk to the Chapter Ninja."

Jill nodded in agreement, and they turned toward the prince and the woodsman.

"Good day to you both, and we'll soon find Red, and Rapunzel." said Jack, and he and Jill went off toward the Chapter Ninja's place.

They soon reached the building. It was well made, and there were paths going out of the back, twisting and turning in all different directions.

The front sign said, "Pathfinders".

Jack banged on the door. It opened wide, to show a grinning man.

"Are you Wenston, leader of the Pathfinders?" asked Jack.

"Yes."

"We need to talk to your Chapter Ninja."

"Uh..." said Wenston, the grin dropped from his face, and he seemed very nervous, "He- he's not here right now."

Jack frowned. "The Chapter Ninja is always here. Are you hiding something?"

Wenston looked even more uncomfortable. "Of course not." he said though, trying to sound calm.

Jill walked forward. "He may not be here, but we must see this wonderful place!" she said eagerly.

Wenston sighed, then said, all right, come in.

Jack and Jill walked in.

"Where is everybody?" asked Jack, looking around.

"Finding paths." answered Wenston.

"Hey, what's this?" asked Jill.

Wenston and Jack ran toward her. She was holding a black suit. She grinned. "I knew it! Wenston, you ARE the Chapter Ninja!
1521.title: Chapter Ninja and the Pathfinders

choices: decides to confront Wenston about his obvious lie
pulls out her wicked ninja style fighting to push Wenston against a wall
15211.content:
"Jill, please I'm almost forty years old!" Wenston looked at Jill with a disgruntled look and took the ninja suit from her hands. "The truth is, our Chapter Ninja went out looking for the perpetrator of these terrible deads. I didn't want to tell you that, cus a lot of eyewitnesses have claimed to see a man in black carrying off the heroes. Our chapter ninja wanted to clear his name. I'm sorry Jill, but I have no idea where this suit came from."

Jill exchanged a look of disbelief with her partner Jack, surely he was lying. Everyone knew the Chapter Ninja was a selfish person. Jill smiled really big at Wenston and,
15211.title: Selfish Ninjas

choices: Run outside to follow the Ninja.
Go back and talk to the Woodsman.
15212.content:
Suddenly, the man they thought was Wenston let out a manical laugh. Jack and Jill exchanged an odd look with each other. "What are you laughing at?" Jill demanded. "You're under arrest, that's no laughing matter!"

The man grinned and pointed a finger at her. "You got one thing right," he said. "I am the Chapter Ninja. But I am not Wenston!"

"You lied to us?" Jack asked. "Why?"

The Chapter Ninja ran forward, stealing the black outfit right out of Jill's hands. She gasped, realizing just how right the Woodsman was about how quick that blasted Ninja could be. Jack and Jill turned around and to their surprise, the Ninja was already dressed up in his outfit.

"Why did I lie?" the Chapter Ninja said, pulling his katana out and pointing it at them. "Because I work for someone who would loathe you knowing their true identity."

"Who do you work for?" Jack demanded, angered that they'd been tricked.

But Jill had caught on right away. "You work for Wenston," she said, eyeing the Chapter Ninja suspiciously.

"Smart girl," the Chapter Ninja observed.

"Why is Wenston kidnapping the Fairy Tale heroes?" Jack asked.

"Who says she is?"

"She?!" Jill and Jack said at the same time.

"I've said too much!" the Ninja yelled and threw down a smoke screen. Jack and Jill coughed. When the smoke cleared, the Chapter Ninja was nowhere to be seen.
15212.title: The Evil Wenston

choices: Go in search of the mysterious Pathfinders
Curse Wenston som more and then do something
152121.content:
The pair ran outside but it was too late. The chapter Ninja was no where to be seen.

"Damn, that Ninja sure is fast." said Jill as she lifted up a toadstool looking for him.

"He was our only lead. Now how will we find that evil Wenston and the fairytale characters." said Jack in Frustration."

"At least we know its Wenston. Perhaps we can find him by finding another one of the Pathfinders."

Jack fell to his knees tearing his shirt and pulling at his hair.


"DAMN YOU WENSTON!!!!!!!"
152121.title: Damn uo Wenston! Damn you!

choices: Kayla
A Wizard's Secret
1521211.content:
"We must look for some Pathfinders." said Jill resolutely.

She and Jack went to the back of the building where there were signs.

Jack began to read a few of them.

"Kayla, by Mystic, or Dog Freek.

A Wizards Secret, by Jamey Dallas."

Which one should we go down? Asked Jack, who seemed at his wits end.
1521211.title: Finding Pathfinders

choices: Dog Freek runs away
Mystic talks to Jack and Jill
15212111.content:
"Well," said Jill, "This seems pretty short. We might as well find the person who started this path.

That's weird. She has two names! What do you think of that, Jack?"

The two started down the path.

"I have no idea. Do you think she has a dual personality?"

"Maybe... Maybe we should've gone down the Wizards secret."

Suddenly, the trail stopped, and turned into several trails. "Just the trick a Pathfinder would pull." muttered Jack.

After a few minutes of arguing, they decided to go down one of the more traveled paths. Then they heard something.

Quietly, the came up on someone, who seemed to be writing on a sign. She was clearly a Pathfinder.

"Mystic or Dog Freek!" called Jill, "We need to speak with you about your leader!"
15212111.title: Searching for the double-named one

choices: Quaddy's World- "The Sword's Edge"
Wenston's World- "My Dark Angel"
152121111.content:
Dog Freek looked at Jack, then Jill, and ran, tearing through the forest and disappearing into the mists that suddenly sprang up from the previously sunny clearings. "God!" Jack spat out a curse and started after her. Only Jill's hand on his shoulder kept him from entering the oh-so-spooky woods.

"Don't go after her! Look! These mists just suddenly rose out of nowhere! Do you really think we'll be able to find her? These Pathfinders clearly have some special powers."

Jack scoffed. "More like they're covering up the horrendous kidnapping of our beloved Fairy Tale heroes and protecting their own!"

"Like the blue wall of silence, or some such nonsense..." Jack looked over at Jill, his eyebrow quirked, and Jill gave a slight shrug. "What? You've never watched Law and Order? Any time a cop did something, his fellow cops would always protect him. It's the blue shield...wall...some such nonsense."

"Law and Order, hmm? Isn't that the one with the sound effect?"

Jill nodded, and the two started down the path, looking for the next branch in the road. "Bom bom!"

"No, it's definitely more of a boink boink..."

"Nuh uh!" Jill looked at Jack in disgust. "You are a complete and total idiot, Jack. I just want you to know that."

Jack shrugged. "Whatever! Oh, look, a crossroads."

"Oh no! It looks like we have to go into the lands of the higher ratings. I don't know, Jack...should we risk it?"

"I think we have to. This Quaddy chick, I think she and Wenston have known each other quite a while. It behooves us to explore her world."

Jill shook her head. "No. Look. The other one is Wenston's own higher-rated story! He might be down that path!"

"Too obvious..."

"I don't think so..."
152121111.title: Of Sound Effects and Higher Ratings

choices: Ask about Wenston
Ask about the missing Fairy Tales
1521211111.content:
Jill sighed. "Fine. Let's go to 'The Sword's Edge'. It might be safer in the end. Crazy vampires or people trying to save their land from foreign invaders? Faeries or Werewolves?"

"I'm all for Faeries," Jack replied.

Heading down the path, the trees became more verident, resplendent in their summer foliage, and the temperature became decidedly more refreshing. For a land supposedly war-torn, this place wasn't bad at all.

"Hello." A voice from within the trees disturbed them, and a young woman stepped over the roots and onto the path. "Can I help you?"

Jill replied. "Yes. Is this Brynvyr?"

The woman nodded. "Indeed. And why have you come to my little corner of the Paths?"

"You're Quaddy?" Jack was shocked. "Why are you dressed like you live here, then?"

Quaddy laughed. "It's easiest when I want to blend in and make sure people are taking care of my baby. It's the only Path I've got."

"Really? We figured someone so close to Wenston would have several..."

Looking around, Quaddy gave another chuckle. "I'm into a Path of a different kind- a circular one. I joined this out of respect for Wenston."

"Speaking of Wenston. We're looking for him. Have you heard or seen him any time in the last few days, or have any idea where he might be? Some of Fairy World's heroes have gone missing and we believe he might have something to do with it."

At this, Quaddy gave a booming laugh and reached up to wipe a tear from her eye. "One. Yes, I have seen Wenston in the last couple of days. Two. I knew about the disappearing heroes and Wenston has nothing to do with it. Three. Wenston isn't a he. Wenny is a she."

Jack and Jill's jaw dropped open. "What?"

"Yeah. Wenston is a girl."
1521211111.title: A Shocking Revelation

choices: Wenston's Port!
Wenston's Path!
152121112.content:
"Yeah?" asked the girl.

"Where is this 'Wenston'?"

"Well," she answered, thinking, "I'm not sure. She tends to add to the paths a lot. It could be any path. You might find her in her home though."

Jack and Jill were embarrased they had both thought "her" a "him". Now they knew otherwise .

"Where is her home?" asked Jill.

"You can find it if you go straight north from the main group building. You will recognise it easily: the house is painted yellow and there's a sign up that says 'What's that funky smell?'"

"Thanks" said Jill politely, and she and Jack turned around to speak to each other.

"Let's go to another path!" said Jack.

"I think we should go to Wenston's home." snapped Jill.
152121112.title: Path or Port?

choices: Back to the Pathfinders' main building and some paths
Ask some people around town what they know about the ninja
1521211121.content:
Jack and Jill argued for several minutes, watched closely by Dog Freek, but finally Jill won, and they headed off to Wenston's home.

They DID find it easily. Like Dog Freek had said, it was painted bright yellow, and there was a very funny, very obvious sign up that demanded to know what that smell was.

Jill knocked on the door. It opened as she knocked. The two went in, and soon found a Guestbook.

Jill immediately began signing it.

"What are you doing???" asked Jack.

"I'm signing the guestbook, whadoya think I'm doing??"

"Why?"

"Because I might get a merit badge!!"

Jack rolled his eyes, and looked around while Jill finished signing.

A few people were walking around, some were reading the many stories and poems, some seemed to be writing notes to the Pathfinders' leader, and some looked kind of lost.

"Wenston isn't here. We might as well go somewhere else." Jack said.
1521211121.title: Wenston's Port!

choices: Go to the city for people who know Wenston
Go to the other path
15212111211.content:
Jack and Jill, after seeing that Wenston wasn't at the port, ran back to their spot.

"Where will we go now?"
15212111211.title: Where to go next?

choices: "Oh, ho! It's the seven dwarfs, Jill!"
"Seven? Why, it's the seven dwarfs,Jack!"
1522.content:
"You know," said Jill with a little giggle as they entered the dark wood. "Rapunzel was a good choice to start with. She should be rather easy to find."

"Why would you say that?" Jack demanded as the world around them grew darker and darker.

"Well, her hair, obviously." Jill replied. "Surely that long trail of hair would be too cumbersome to carry all at once. It's probably trailing miles behind them like a line of golden paint."

"Uh, Jill,"

"And I'm sure you remember her horrid singing voice. Why, if the kidnapper hasn't covered her mouth, she could just hit that high note she's so fond of." Jill giggled again.

"Jill..."

"And maybe, just maybe, her singing and long hair would make the kidnapper tire of her and she'll be left in this dark forest to weep and wait for you to rescue her, Jack. How would that be?" Jill quipped, a small smile on her lips.

"Jill, now is not the time, I assure you." Jack said as he halted. "We're being watched."

"Are we?" Jill glanced around. She hadn't realized how far in they had gone or how dark it was getting but now she saw that she could only see a few feet in front of her.

"You are!" came the hissing response to her left.

"Don't sneak up on me like that!" Jill shouted, though she honestly didn't know who she was shouting at.

"Why not?" came another voice in front of her and Jack.

"Because...I'm a lady," she said as she crossed her arms. Jack glanced at her over his shoulder and shook his head.

"A lady? You hear that, boys? We got a lady in our midst!" came a voice behind her and laughter, harsh and rough, rose up all around them.

"How many of you are there?" Jack demanded. He was surprised when they answered but no longer fearful.

"Seven."
1522.title: To the woods

choices: Leave the forest
Take your chances with the dwarfs
15221.content:
"What of it?" another voice demanded. "Who are you, anyway?"

"Why, I'm Jack Crown!" Jack said with a flourish. "And this is Jill Pail."

"Jack and Jill, huh? Any tumbles down hills lately?" laughed another voice to their right.

"That was a one time thing..."Jack insisted.

"A tumble down a hill with a lady no less!" said the original speaker to their left. "What are you doing in our forest?"

"Looking for a man dressed in all black dragging a blond-haired beauty in his wake," Jack said as he turned a full circle, speaking to all sides.

"We're looking for a man dressed in red that stole Snow White from the cottage." the dwarf to the left spoke again.

"What's your name?" Jill asked as she faced the general area of the speaker.

"Grumpy, of course," he huffed. "What's it to you?"

"Just simplifying things a bit," Jill answered.

"Now, Snow White was a lady...a princess. You're just a girl in our forest without permission."

"Look, this is getting us nowhere. Did a man pass through here with a blond-haired angel or not?" Jack demanded and Jill looked at him with a raised eyebrow.

"You do realize that the prince gets the girl in the end, right?" Grumpy asked and Jack clenched his fists. "We didn't see no man in black with a blond-haired girl in tow. Now leave or forest."

"Or?"

"Or we dwarfs stop playing nice."
15221.title: The Dwarfs

info.brief_description: The most prominent names in Fairy Tales have gone missing.  Chaos ensues.
info.description:
** Image ID #1133809 Unavailable **


Fairy Tales' Most Wanted



The most prominent names in Fairy Tales have suddenly gone missing. In their absence, the Tales have errupted into chaos. Who's taking the beloved characters? How will we get them back?

Follow Detectives Jack Crown and Jill Pail as they travel through the most famous Fairy Tales looking for clues to who the culprit could be while at the same time trying to restore order to the upturned Tales. It may be scary, it may be funny, it may be mysterious, but the Jack and Jill will do anything to ensure the Fairy Tales have their Happily Ever Afters.




The Missing Heroes
The following is a list of all known missing Fairy Tale characters.
If you should happen to locate one, please contact the Bureau of
Hero Rights immediately.
